titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the VisitLEX promotional slides, circa 1980s-1990s 2018av003
titlestmt.author: Robin Spratling, Jason Flahardy, and Megan Mummey

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-06-07 16:49:58 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.unittitle: VisitLEX promotional slides
did.abstract: The VisitLEX slides (dated circa 1980s-1990s; 0.27 cubic feet; two boxes) contain slides along with some negatives and photographs, created and used by VisitLEX during the 1980s and 1990s to promote the city of Lexington and the Bluegrass Region of Kentucky as a travel destination.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection retains its original order.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: VisitLEX, the Lexington Convention and Visitors Bureau, was established by the Lexington-Fayette County Urban Government in 1974 to market and promote the city of Lexington and the Bluegrass Region of Kentucky a travel and meeting destination.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The VisitLEX slides (dated circa 1980s-1990s; 0.27 cubic feet; 2 boxes) contains slide along with some negatives and photographs, created and used by VisitLEX during the 1980s and 1990s to promote the city of Lexington and the Bluegrass Region of Kentucky as a travel destination. They were commissioned by VisitLEX and created by several independent photographers over several years. The slides retain their original arrangement and are organized by topic. The topics include horse farms, downtown Lexington, Rupp Arena, distilleries, bluegrass music, the University of Kentucky, specific events, shopping, and a squirrel drinking out of a UK cup.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.
The intellectual rights to the materials in this collection are held by the individual photographers and the Louisville Courier-Journal.

A close up image of a group of unknown fans posing for a picture together.
A close up image of an unknown photographer taking a picture of the basketball game.
A close up, blurred image of the audience standing up and waving their arms around.
A close up image of an unidentified man and child sitting together and watching the basketball game. The young child is pointing towards the basketball court.

An image of the basketball hoop and a large portion of the audience sitting behind the hoop. A blurred image of the basketball players are in front of the basketball hoop, trying to grab the basketball.
An image of the audience. The majority of them are sitting down. Some have their arms in the air while others are clapping their hands.

An image taken from a side angle on the court. The basketball hoop is seen off to the side of the image while a majority of the audience is seen on the sides of the basketball hoop. There is a blurred image of the basketball players playing on the court in front of the basketball hoop.

A large group of unknown men sitting in a row at a table right off of the court. Some of the men are wearing headphones. A banner is on the front of the table with the words NCAA Southeast Regional University of Kentucky.

A close image of the audience. Most of the audience is sitting and watching the game. There is one unidentified man, off to the side of the image, standing up with both of his arms raised. He appears to be yelling.

A close image of some of the basketball fans in the audience. Many of them are standing up and clapping their hands or raising their arms in the air. One unidentified man has on a jersey and is clapping his hands.
An image of another part of the audience. An unidentified man and woman are standing up with their arms raised and appear to be yelling. Everyone else around them are seated.
An image of a sign that a group of fans are holding up. The bottom area of the sign is not seen but the top of the sign reads Cincinnati Buries, with the C and B in red letters.
An image taken from the back side view of a cheerleader yelling into a megaphone towards the large audience.
A side frontal image of a pep band.The pep band is wearing matching red jackets.
A front end view of the pep band. The front of the pep band is raising their arms while the back of the pep band have their instruments up.
A front view from behind the basketball hoop. An unknown player is jumping up and throwing the basketball. The referee is seen off to the side of the image, watching the basketball.
A close, blurred image of two unidentified fans clapping their hands. Seen behind them, is a clearer image of two unidentified female fans clapping and cheering.
A contact sheet including images not seen in the slide collection and some repeated images already documented by the slides of Rupp Arena.
A contact sheet including images not seen in the slide collection and some repeated images already documented by the slide collection of Rupp Arena.
